content.description:
This is a super fun finger crack on a lower angle formation but is not a slab climb. The hard part is the beginning of the small crack. 

  Rap anchors at the top, and a 60 meter rope is fine. There is no real good way to reach the anchors from the top to set up a top rope.
content.protection: 2-3 #3's   2-3 #.75   2-3 #.5   Set of nuts and some longer slings.
content.location: This is the first crack route to the right of the big chimney called Dingus Magee. Just look for the finger crack.

content.description:
Mixed route to the left of "Blow". Climbs up face to 1st bolt, then a small ledge above that which could take some small - medium cams. Finger crack above the ledge and another bolt up and to the left of it. Leaving the finger crack and getting above the 2nd bolt is the crux of the route, very small crimpy edges and slopers to support you getting up to the last bolt, then easy ground to 2 anchors with rap rings.

 Fun route - if you've got an anchor set up on the top of blow, you can lower yourself down to the anchor of this route (climbers left) and set up a top rope for this one. The crux is pretty tricky and delicate but do-able, look for those small edges and crystal nodules to smear on.
content.protection: 3 bolts and small - medium cams + 2 anchors w/ rap bolts up top.
content.location: Just left of Blow - first bolt is up and right of a small, left-ward trending flake.

climbs.name: Blow
climbs.fa: Jake Ellis, Rachael Chlebowy, Clay Lippincott, Connie Lippincott

content.description: It is so hard to describe this hand crack, other than the first time I climbed it I had to climb it 3 more times.    It's just a great hand crack.
content.protection: Standard single rack with extra cams in the 2" - 3".    There are rap anchors at the top. You must climb the route to establish a top rope. A 60 meter rope is fine.
content.location: To the left of Dingus Magee.

climbs.name: Adventures of Bad Billy & Dingus Magee

content.description: Starts as a chimney and mixed block climbing, as soon as possible get into the hand crack on the right and take it until it turns to off width. You can continue straight up the off width or you can jump left over the gap to easier climbing to the top. Belay from the big tree on top. This is a walk off the back side! ... The rock quality at the top is not all that great.
content.protection: Bring a single rack and extras of 3" to 6".
content.location: Dingus is the chimney in the center of the formation that is full of blocks in the bottom section. It also has a few small tree's in it that make things interesting.
